title: Principles of Analysis
description: Comprehensive study of analysis with emphasis on theoretical foundations and practical applications.

title: Introduction to Methods
description: In-depth analysis of methods principles. Students will develop critical thinking and problem-solving skills.

title: Practice
description: Interdisciplinary approach to practice combining theoretical knowledge with practical problem-solving.

title: Applied Analysis
description: Advanced exploration of analysis covering current research and industry practices.

title: Methods
description: Fundamental concepts and applications of methods. Designed for students pursuing careers in related fields.

title: Research
description: In-depth analysis of research principles. Students will develop critical thinking and problem-solving skills.

title: Theory
description: Fundamental concepts and applications of theory. Designed for students pursuing careers in related fields.

title: Special Topics in Methods
description: Comprehensive study of methods with emphasis on theoretical foundations and practical applications.
prerequisites: STAT 350 and senior standing or graduate status

prerequisites: STAT 322 and senior standing or graduate status

prerequisites: STAT 379 and senior standing or graduate status
